intro: Symplocos uniflora var. paleacea, commonly known as the pale-flowered wax myrtle, is a shrub native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. Its flowers are pale yellow and clustered in small inflorescences, giving it a subtle and delicate appearance. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that ripens to a deep red, attracting various birds and small mammals.
